title: At school in southern Lebanon, an aid stop for people fleeing conflict
description: Lebanon’s port Tyre becomes another hub for people fleeing conflict.

title: Canada withdraws diplomats from India after threat to revoke immunity
description: India’s ultimatum came amid a simmering dispute over allegations that agents of the Indian government might have been behind the murder of a Sikh separatist in Canada.

title: China’s nuclear arsenal on track to double by 2030, Pentagon reports
description: Beijing has made dramatic advances in ‘scale and complexity’ of sea, air and land military platforms, official says.

title: China is set to dominate the deep sea and its wealth of rare metals
description: The ocean floor is shaping up to be the next theater of global resource competition, and China’s diplomatic efforts are positioning it to lead in deep-sea mining.

title: Category 4 Hurricane Norma threatens Mexico while Tammy nears Caribbean
description: The Pacific and Atlantic storms could both produce flooding rains over land areas into the weekend

title: Russia detains radio journalist accused of being ‘foreign agent’
description: Alsu Kurmasheva, who is a Prague-based editor for Radio Free Europe/Radio Liberty and holds dual Russian and U.S. citizenship, was arrested while in Russia to see family members.

title: British prime minister pledges support for Israel, urges aid for Gaza
description: Sunak told Netanyahu that he was “proud to stand here with you in Israel’s darkest hour.”

title: Gazan families face agonizing choices as they search for safety
description: In texts, voice notes and phone calls, Gazans described the agony of trying to figure out where to seek shelter in the midst of Israel’s relentless airstrikes.

title: U.S.-approved aid faces steep hurdles to reach desperate Gazans
description: President Biden’s aid announcement aside, humanitarian experts warn that many obstacles need to be overcome before Gazans will see any succor.

title: Journalists killed in the Israel-Gaza war: A look at six lives lost
description: Reuters journalist Issam Abdallah and Palestinian photojournalist Muhammad Sobh were among those killed while reporting on the Israel-Gaza war.

title: What is Islamic Jihad, the group Israel blamed for Gaza hospital strike?
description: The U.S. has labeled the Sunni Muslim militant group a foreign terrorist organization. It is smaller than Hamas but shares a belief that Israel should be destroyed.

title: In photos: The Israel-Gaza war’s devastation
description: Israel continues to bombard Gaza in its war against Hamas. President Biden announced an aid plan for Israel and humanitarian assistance to Gaza and the West Bank.

title: Israel-Gaza war live updates: Biden announces Gaza aid deal; Israel ‘not responsible’ for hospital strike, U.S. says
description: President Biden said Egypt will allow up to 20 aid trucks through the Rafah crossing into Gaza. He will discuss the U.S. response to the war on Thursday evening.

title: Rebuffed by China, Philippines’ Marcos toughens line on contested waters
description: Philippine president’s resolve to push back in the South China Sea against China has been hardening over the last ten months, fueled in part by continuing harassment.

title: Damage maps of Gaza’s hardest-hit areas in the first days of war
description: A look at an initial damage assessment of Gaza’s hardest-hit areas since the start of the Israel-Gaza war.

title: State Dept. official resigns, citing objection to Israel arms transfers
description: Josh Paul’s departure from the State Department is a rare measure of internal dissent over the Biden administration’s robust support for Israel.

title: U.S. eases sanctions on Venezuelan oil after Maduro agrees to elections
description: The announcement came a day after the government of President Nicolás Maduro and the U.S.-backed opposition agreed to terms for a competitive presidential election next year.

title: Everything we know about the Gaza hospital strike
description: Israeli and Palestinian officials have traded blame for the hospital strike Tuesday that local officials say killed more than 470 people. Here’s what we know.

title: Dutch man admits to 2005 murder of Natalee Holloway. Here’s what to know.
description: Joran van der Sloot, the now-36-year-old man long believed to have killed Natalee Holloway in Aruba, admitted to the murder Wednesday as part of a plea deal.
